publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / beta maṣāḥǝft

availability.licence: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra (name of ʾƎgziʾabǝḥer in Texts I-1 and I-2, name of St. Mary in Text I-4 and I-5); one or two lines of each Ps. in Text I-1; titles and numbers of the Pss., Canticles and Songs; names of the Hebrew letters and their interpretations in Ps. 118; letters ስ and ሕ in the word ስብሕዎ in Ps. 150; letters ባ, ክ and ዎ in the word ይባርክዎ in the Canticle 10; a few words and their abbreviation (introducing each strophe) in Text I-4 and I-5; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals. A few lines on the incipit page of all texts and the sections of Text I-4.

msItem.note: - The following Pss. are numbered incorrectly: Pss. 46: ፵፭, 48: ፶፰, 49: ፶፱, 86: ፹፭, 92: ፺፩, 93: ፺፪, 110: ፻፳, 111:፻፳፩, 112: ፻፳፪.

collation.signatures: Decorated Decorated quire marks in the left corner of the upper margin of fols. 10r, 18r, 26r, 34r, 42r, 50r, 58r, 66r, 74r, 82r, 90r, 98r, 106r.

supportDesc.condition: The spine cover has been crudely repaired with recent synthetic threads. Some fols. are stained with wax: e.g., fols. 2r-3v, or water: e.g., fols. 2r-5v, 12r-13r, 16r-19r. Holes are burnt on fols. 17 and 19. Some fols. are torn along the inner vertical ruling line: e.g., fols. 11, 23, 34. Holes and tears amended on fols. 1, 10, 47, 49, 70, 88, 97.

layout.note: Texts: I-1, 1-2, 1-3: all data are for fol. 3r.
layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

layout.note: Texts I-4, I-5: all data are for fol. 103r.
layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

handDesc.handNote:
Careful, in a well- trained hand Black, redThe name of the scribe has been erased from the concluding supplication on fol. 113va.Early 18th cent. (?)
Text I-4
ሰ፡ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት፡ (e.g., fols. 103vab, 104vb, 106ra, 109rb)
ሰ፡ ለ፡ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት፡ (e.g., fol. 106va)
ሰ፡ ቅ፡ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት፡ (e.g., fol. 107ra)
ሰ፡ ለ፡ ቅ፡ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት፡ (e.g., fols. 102ra-109vb)
Words or their abbreviations stand for the whole refrain:
ሠረ፡ for ሠረቀ፡ በሥጋ፡ እምድንግል፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ዘርአ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fol. 102rb)
እስ፡ for እስመ፡ በፈቃዱ፡ ወበሥምረቱ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ መጽአ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fols. 103ra-104ra)
ነዓ፡(ብ) for ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ። እስመ፡ ሣህልኪ፡ ይኵን፡ ላዕለ፡ ኵልነ (fols. 106ra-107ra)
ተፈ፡ for ተፈሥሒ፡ ኦምልዕልተ፡ ጸጋ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እስመ፡ ረከብኪ፡ ሞገስ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ምስሌኪ (fols. 108va-109ra)
ወበ፡ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (fol. 109vab)
Text I-5
ወ፡ ሣ፡ ይ፡ ሰ፡ for ወልድኪ፡ ሣህሎ፡ ይክፍለነ፡ ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት፡ (fols. 111ra-113ra)
ወል፡ ሣ፡ ይ፡ ሰ፡ ለ፡ ቅ፡ for ወልድኪ፡ ሣህሎ፡ ይክፍለነ፡ ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት፡ (fol. 110rb)
The abbreviations stand for the whole refrain:
በእ፡(ን) for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (fols. 110vb-112vb)
The handwriting is characterized by a fine, rounded and slanted script.

decoDesc.decoNote: - Fol. 2r (incipit page of Text I-1): frontispiece elaborate coloured (vivid red, vivid orange, strong amber, black) ornamental frame: wide horizontal band with two lateral pendants reaching the bottom of the page; interlaces, floral and anthropomorphic motifs.
- Fol. 30v (incipit page of Ps. 51): elaborate coloured (vivid red, vivid orange, strong amber, black) ornamental band; interlaces, floral motifs.
- Fol. 59r (incipit page of Ps. 101): elaborate coloured (vivid red, vivid orange, strong amber, black) ornamental band; interlaces, geometric motifs.
- Fol. 87v (incipit page of Text I-2): elaborate coloured (vivid red, vivid orange, strong amber, black) ornamental band; interlaces, floral motifs. Similar to the band on fol. 30v.
- Fol. 96v (incipit page of Text I-3): elaborate coloured (vivid red, vivid orange, strong amber, black) ornamental band; interlaces, floral motifs.
- Fol. 102r (incipit page of Text I-4): elaborate coloured (vivid red, vivid orange, strong amber, black) ornamental band; interlaces, floral, anthropomorphic and geometric motifs.
- Fol. 110ra (incipit page of Text I-5): coloured (strong red and black) ornamental band; interlaces, floral motifs.

list.item:
Fols. 101v, 114r: Protective prayer.Fol. 101v: በስመ፡”…ውጽኡ[n.l.]፡ አንተ፡ ዓይነት፡ ዘሥራይ፡ ወጽላዋጌ፡ ዘከመ፡ ወጽአ፡ ዮሴፍ፡ በህልም፡ አመሕሸን፡ ፈተሕሸን፡ ሕሸን፡ ርቦቶ፡ ሁራ...
The text begins on fol. 101v and continues on fol. 114r. Some parts of the text are hardly legible because of faded ink.

Fol. 113vb: Miracle of the Archangel Raphael.Fol. 113vb: ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ሩፋኤል፡ ጸሎቱ፡ ወበረከቱ፡ የሃሉ፡ ምስሌነ፡ ለዓለም፡ ለዝንቱ፡ መልአክ፡ ተውህቦ፡ ሥልጣን፡ እምእግዚእብሔር፡ ዘኢተውህቦ፡ ለካልአኒሁ። መላእክት፡ ከመ፡ ይፍታሕ፡ ማህፀናተ፡ መካናተ፡ ዘሰብእ፡ ወእንስሳ...
The text is hardly legible because of faded ink.

Fol. 113vb: Calendaric note.
The text is hardly legible because of faded ink.

- The Pss. are divided into groups of ten separated by a chain of asterisks between two lines of alternating black and red dots. - The scribe reduced the size of his handwriting to accommodate the end of the line: e.g., fols. 13r, 14v, 40r, 67r, 70r, 100v. - Part of the line is taken up: e.g., fols. 13v, 49v, 88r, 90v, 98v. - Omissions inserted interlineally, in the main hand: e.g., fols. 2r, 57r, 64v, 77rv, 95v, 105ra; in a secondary hand: e.g., fols. 32v, 43r. - Corrections written over erased words and passages: e.g., fols. 12v, 79r, 85r, 106va, 113rb. - Instructions concerning the use of some Pss. written in a secondary hand: e.g., fols. 8v, 11v, 31r, 57v. - Pen trial: fol. 114r. - Erased (supplication) notes: e.g., fols. 76v, 77rv, 96v. - Short supplications for (ʾabunä) Gäbrä Mäsqäl, in a secondary hand: e.g., fols. 49r, 55r. - Short supplications in different hands: e.g, fols. 30r (name erased) and 96v. - Crude drawings (crosses and a human face): fols. 1v, 16v, 114v. - Crude notes in ink, pen and pencil: fols. 1r (hardly legible because of faded ink), 55v, 56r, 73v, 99r, 113v, 114r. - Scribbles, in pencil: e.g., fols. 1v, 17r, 18v.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; textile inlays (a mirror might have once been attached to the inner side of the front board). Overback made of reddish-brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.
Traces of two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.
Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover has faded. Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown overback (at least one tool was used: triple line fillet).

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: The name of the original donor has been erased from the concluding supplication on fol. 113va and replaced with that of Fǝśśǝḥa Ṣǝyon (?), in a secondary hand. In later supplications Gäbrä Mäsqäl is mentioned (e.g., fols. 49r, 55r).

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
